paragraph.paragraph:
Right clicking on a node in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.xml Solution Explorer will bring up a context menu that allows you to perform certain actions relative to that node. For an Eiffel Project there two main types of context menus, one for the Eiffel project itself, and one for the files contained within your project directory, be it either an Eiffel Class or a miscellaneous file.
paragraph.heading: 2 Project Context Menu
paragraph.paragraph: In the image above we can see the context menu for the Eiffel project 'My Eiffel Project'. The entries available on the context menu perform the following actions:

list.item:
Build: Builds the Eiffel project (
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/60_Compiling_Projects/index.xml Compiling ).

Rebuild: Rebuilds the Eiffel project (
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/60_Compiling_Projects/index.xml Compiles completely from scratch).

Add: This allows you to
/10_Developing/20_Managing_Projects/20_Adding_New_Project_Items/index.xml Add a New or Existing Item to the Eiffel project.
Add Reference: This allows .Net assembly references to be added to the system.
Set as StartUp Project: Sets the project to be the one that is launched on solution execution.
Debug: Allows you to execute or step in to the Eiffel project.
Save My Eiffel Project.eifp: This saves the project file associated with this project.
Remove: Removes the project from the current solution
Rename: Allows the project name to be changed
Properties: Display the main Property Page for the project.

paragraph.heading: 2 File Context Menu
paragraph.paragraph: In the image just above we can see the context menu for the Eiffel class file 'root_class.e'. The entries available on the context menu perform the following actions:

list.item: Open: This opens the file in the default editor.
Open With: This allows you to choose which editor you want to open the file with.
View Code: Brings up the Code View for an Eiffel Class
View Designer: Brings up the Design View Eiffel Classes representing Forms
Remove: Remove the file from the project.
Rename: Change the name of the file.
Properties: Bring up the property page for the file

paragraph.heading: 2 References Context Menu
paragraph.paragraph: In the image just above we can see the context menu for the Mscorlib Assembly reference. The entries available on the context menu perform the following actions.

list.item: Remove: This allows the assembly reference to be removed from the current project
Properties: This will bring up the Reference Properties pane showing information relating to the referenced assembly
